items.title: How to Access the Internet Browser on PS5 (Updated for 2025)
items.summary: Sony has been making it increasingly difficult to access a web browser…
items.content_html:
Sony has been making it increasingly difficult to access a web browser on the PlayStation 5, blocking many of the previously known methods. If you're looking for ways to browse the web on your PS5 in 2025, this guide will walk you through the latest working techniques.

Method 1: Using PSN Messaging to Open URLs

One of the easiest ways to access a browser on your PS5 is by sending a URL to a friend in a PlayStation Network (PSN) message.

Steps:

  1. Find a friend‚Äôs PSN account (you can use an old or inactive account).

  2. Send a message containing a working URL.

    • As of now, Google, YouTube, Bing, and DuckDuckGo are all blocked.

    • Brave.com is currently the best alternative because it includes a search engine.

  3. Open the message on your PS5 and click the link.

  4. This will launch the browser and allow you to navigate from there.

üí° Bonus Tip: You can also use a custom dashboard website like kacboy.com/PS5 that provides quick links to popular sites.

Method 2: The Watch Dogs 2 Web Browser Trick

This is a unique workaround that utilizes a built-in browser within the game Watch Dogs 2 (available on PlayStation Plus).

Steps:

  1. Download and launch Watch Dogs 2 from PlayStation Plus.

  2. From the main menu, look at the lower-right corner where social media news items appear.

  3. Click on the second news item, which leads to a Twitter/X support page.

  4. On that page, scroll to the footer and click the Google Chrome link.

  5. This will open a full-screen browser where you can access Google Search.

‚ö†Ô∏è Limitations:

  • You can‚Äôt go back using the Circle button‚Äîpressing it closes the browser completely.

  • You may need to restart from the Twitter/X page if you navigate away.

  • Enable JavaScript and cookies in settings if you encounter login issues.

Other PS5 Games with Built-in Browsers

According to user comments, the following PS5 games also have built-in browsers that can be accessed similarly:

  • Watch Dogs 2

  • Dying Light 1

  • Red Dead Redemption 2

  • Uno

  • Battlefield 2042

  • Minecraft

Additional Browser Settings for Better Usability

If you're planning to browse frequently, consider these tweaks:

  • Enable Accessibility Zoom: Allows you to zoom into the browser window.

  • Pin the Browser: Keeps the browser running in the background.

  • Disable In-Game Music (if using Watch Dogs 2): This prevents audio interference.

Final Thoughts

Sony seems intent on restricting browser access, and it's possible they may block messaging-based URL sharing in the future. Until then, these methods are your best bet for getting online through your PS5.

items.content_html:
The PlayStation Portal is designed primarily for Remote Play, and Sony has severely limited web browsing capabilities. However, there are still a few ways to access the internet through your PS Portal. This guide will walk you through the latest working methods in 2025.

Method 1: Using the Hidden PS Portal Browser

Unlike the PS5, the PS Portal actually has a built-in browser that can be accessed through system settings.

Steps:

  1. Go to Settings on your PS Portal.

  2. Navigate to Legal Notices ‚Üí Other Documents.

  3. Click on any link within this section to open the PlayStation website.

  4. From there, you can browse within PlayStation.com, but external links will be blocked.

‚ö†Ô∏è Limitations:

  • You can only access PlayStation-related content.

  • Some embedded YouTube videos on PlayStation‚Äôs site may work, but external links are restricted.

Method 2: Using PSN Messaging to Open URLs

Since the built-in browser is extremely limited, the best alternative is to open a web browser via PSN messages‚Äîsimilar to how it works on PS5.

Steps:

  1. Find an old or inactive PSN account to send messages to.

  2. Send a message containing a working URL.

    • Google, YouTube, Bing, and DuckDuckGo are blocked.

    • Brave.com is currently the best working search engine alternative.

  3. Open the message on your PS Portal and click the link.

  4. This will launch the browser, giving you some access to external websites.

üí° Bonus Tip: You can also use a custom website like kacboy.com/PS5, which has quick links to popular web destinations.

Method 3: Watch Dogs 2 Web Browser Trick

A lesser-known workaround involves using Watch Dogs 2 (available on PlayStation Plus), which includes a browser in its main menu.

Steps:

  1. Download and launch Watch Dogs 2 from PlayStation Plus.

  2. From the main menu, look at the lower-right corner where social media news items appear.

  3. Click the second news item, which leads to a Twitter/X support page.

  4. Scroll to the bottom of that page and click the Google Chrome link.

  5. This will open a full-screen browser where you can access Google Search.

‚ö†Ô∏è Limitations:

  • You can‚Äôt go back using the Circle button‚Äîpressing it closes the browser completely.

  • There‚Äôs no accessibility zoom on the PS Portal, making navigation difficult.

  • No full-screen mode, which limits usability.

Other PS5 Games with Built-in Browsers

According to user comments, the following PS5 games also have built-in browsers that can be accessed similarly:

  • Watch Dogs 2

  • Dying Light 1

  • Red Dead Redemption 2

  • Uno

  • Battlefield 2042

  • Minecraft

Final Thoughts

While Sony continues to restrict browser functionality on PlayStation devices, these methods are still viable for now. The PS Portal‚Äôs built-in browser is mostly locked down, so your best bet is using the PSN messaging method or the Watch Dogs 2 trick.

items.title: How to Fix HDR Issues on PlayStation Portal
items.summary: For PlayStation Portal users, the HDR streaming issue has been a long-standing…
items.content_html:
For PlayStation Portal users, the HDR streaming issue has been a long-standing frustration. Despite the Portal's LCD screen lacking HDR support, the PS5 continues to stream an HDR signal, leading to blown-out visuals. While one would expect an easy fix from Sony, the issue persists. Fortunately, thanks to a clever workaround discovered by a Reddit user, there is now a simple solution to toggle HDR effectively.

Understanding the HDR Issue

The PlayStation Portal, with its LCD screen, does not support HDR. However, the PS5‚Äôs default settings may still transmit an HDR video signal, which results in an overexposed and washed-out image. Many users have tried turning off HDR settings on their PS5s, but Sony has restricted access to screen and display settings when using Remote Play, making the fix more challenging. Some users resort to unplugging their PS5‚Äôs HDMI cable as a workaround, which is highly inconvenient.

Testing the Issue

Using HDR test footage, we have confirmed that the PlayStation Portal struggles with brightness levels above 350 nits, leading to significant loss of detail. Games like Death Stranding, Mafia 2, Ghost of Tsushima, and Spider-Man 2 exhibit severe highlight loss, making the visuals almost unreadable in bright areas. Even when HDR is turned off, the conversion remains poor, failing to properly translate highlights into SDR levels.

The Quick Fix: Invert Colors Trick

A Reddit user named dioro discovered an effective method to disable HDR on the PlayStation Portal:

Steps to Disable HDR on PlayStation Portal

  1. Press the PlayStation button to open the Control Center.

  2. Press the Options button to open the Edit menu.

  3. Add the Accessibility menu to your Control Center.

  4. In the Accessibility menu, enable Invert Colors.

Why This Works

On the PS5, enabling Invert Colors changes the screen‚Äôs color scheme, but on the PlayStation Portal, it effectively disables HDR. This trick successfully restores detail to bright areas, making visuals significantly clearer and preserving gameplay details that were previously washed out.

Comparing Before and After

Testing this fix on various games and HDR test footage confirms that inverting colors mimics the effect of fully disabling HDR. Details in bright skies, highlights in gameplay, and general visibility improve dramatically, making the PlayStation Portal experience much more enjoyable.

Conclusion

While this isn‚Äôt the perfect solution (Sony should ideally provide an official HDR toggle for Remote Play), this workaround provides an easy and effective fix. If you‚Äôve been struggling with HDR issues on the PlayStation Portal, try enabling Invert Colors through the Accessibility menu and enjoy a better viewing experience.
